structure.unit: TRAFFIC REGULATIONS -- VEHICLE EQUIPMENT AND STORAGE

law.catch_line: Right-of-way to public safety vehicle or to pedestrian engaged in work on highway.

text.section: The operator of a vehicle shall yield the right-of-way to any public safety vehicle, as defined in KRS 189.910(2), or any pedestrian actually engaged in work upon a highway or within any highway construction or maintenance area indicated by official traffic control devices.

The operator of a vehicle shall yield the right-of-way to any public safety vehicle obviously and actually engaged in work upon a highway whenever such vehicle displays flashing lights meeting the requirements of KRS 189.920(4).

law.history: Amended 2011 Ky. Acts ch. 59, sec. 1, effective June 8, 2011. -- Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 46, sec. 10, effective June 17, 1978.
